docs.snippet: Australia defender Matthew Spiranovic has warned his team mates to expect a "hostile" reception when the Socceroos take on Saudi Arabia in their Asian section World Cup qualifier in Jeddah on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Australia defender Matthew Spiranovic has warned his team mates to expect a "hostile" reception when the Socceroos take on Saudi Arabia in their Asian section World Cup qualifier in Jeddah on Thursday.

headline.main: Australia's Spiranovic Warns of 'Hostile' Saudi Crowd

docs.snippet: Chinese investment in European soccer is no short-term phenomenon and the opportunities it offers for the continent’s clubs are “extraordinary”, according to the CEO of Inter Milan, one of the latest big names to come under Chine...
docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese investment in European soccer is no short-term phenomenon and the opportunities it offers for the continent’s clubs are “extraordinary”, according to the CEO of Inter Milan, one of the latest big names to come under Chinese ownership.

headline.main: China Offers 'Extraordinary Prize' for Europe's Clubs: Inter Boss
headline.print_headline: China Offers 'Extraordinary Prize' for Europe's Clubs: Inter Boss

docs.snippet: The head of WADA's athlete commission contends the global anti-doping system is not "broken" and laments that politics surrounding the Russian doping scandal has sown "discord" in the fight against performance-enhancing drugs....
docs.lead_paragraph: The head of WADA's athlete commission contends the global anti-doping system is not "broken" and laments that politics surrounding the Russian doping scandal has sown "discord" in the fight against performance-enhancing drugs.

headline.main: Athletes Representative Says Anti-Doping System 'Not Broken'
headline.print_headline: Athletes Representative Says Anti-Doping System 'Not Broken'

docs.snippet: When a female Christ figure was shown at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in 1984, a church official ordered its removal. Now it has returned as the centerpiece of a new exhibit....
docs.lead_paragraph: When a female Christ figure was shown at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine in 1984, a church official ordered its removal. Now it has returned as the centerpiece of a new exhibit.
docs.abstract: Edwina Sandys sculpture Christa, depicting crucified woman, is returning to Cathedral of St John the Divine in Manhattan, more than three decades after it was removed from church by Episcopal Diocese of New York amid accusations of blasphemy; 250-pound bronze statue is centerpiece of exhibit The Christa Project: Manifesting Divine Bodies, featuring works that reinterpret image of Jesus.

headline.main: An ‘Evolving’ Episcopal Church Invites Back a Controversial Sculpture
headline.print_headline: Once Ordered Removed, Statue Is Now Embraced by Church

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Cathedral Church of St John the Divine (Manhattan, NY)

docs.snippet: In a story Oct. 5 about North Carolina politics, The Associated Press reported erroneously that state legislator Chris Sgro is the state's first openly gay legislator. There have been at least two openly gay legislators who have served previously ...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Oct. 5 about North Carolina politics, The Associated Press reported erroneously that state legislator Chris Sgro is the state's first openly gay legislator. There have been at least two openly gay legislators who have served previously in the General Assembly; Sgro is not the first.
